overview_of_class: This course charts the dissident aesthetic practices and theories that emerged along various transatlantic axes in the 1960s under the banner of anti-imperialism. We will consider the contributions and collaborations of radical and militant artists, filmmakers, and thinkers in Africa, the Americas, and Europe, from the Oakland-based Black Panthers and the Argentine film movement Grupo Cine Liberación to the Paris-based Situationists and the participants of the First Pan-African Cultural Festival in Algiers in 1969.
name: Special Topics in 20th Century Art
title: WCAS ART_HIST 368-0-1 Special Topics in 20th Century Art
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: REASON: Pre-registration is not allowed for this class. Please try again during regular registration.

We will consider the contributions and collaborations of radical and militant artists, filmmakers, and thinkers in Africa, the Americas, and Europe, from the Oakland-based Black Panthers and the Argentine film movement Grupo Cine Liberación to the Paris-based Situationists and the participants of the First Pan-African Cultural Festival in Algiers in 1969.
